ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Choice

Best match.Title: Apply for building regulation approval | Knowsley Council
Best match.Reason: This result provides a simple online form to request permission, aligning with David's need for a clear, step-by-step process to make small changes to his flat and his preference for online services.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Page
ai_page.body:
Apply for building regulation approval

Building regulations set standards for the design and construction of buildings for health and safety purposes, energy conservation and access to and about buildings.

About building regulation approval

If you are looking to carry out a building project, such as an extension or loft conversion, you may need to apply for building regulation approval.

To find out if your proposed development requires building regulation approval, visit the building regulations section of the National Planning Portal and look at the interactive home guide. You can also use our Merseyside guide to extending your home.

Planning permission

Complying with building regulations is a separate matter from getting planning permission for your work. The Planning Portal website has an interactive home guide which will help you identify if you need building regulation approval, planning permission or both.

Developers

If you are a developer and familiar with building regulations and the building control system, you can find technical guidance organised around 'Parts A to P' of the requirements of the regulations on the National Planning Portal.

Electrical safety

Find out more about electrical safety in the download below.

  • Electrical safety.pdf (PDF, 21.4KB)

Apply for Building Regulations Approval

  • Building Notice Application Form
  • OR
  • Full Plans Application Form
  • Full Plans Application Guidance & Checklist

Please Note: If you are unsure which form you should use or type of application you should submit, please see the following link or contact Knowsley MBC Building Control on 0151 443 2029 / 0151 443 5830 or by email at bcsubmissions@knowsley.gov.uk

LABC Front Door | Home improvements & building regulations advice for homeowners and builders

Retrospective Approval

If you have already carried out the work and require retrospective (regularisation) approval, please contact Knowsley MBC Building Control on 0151 443 2029 / 0151 443 5830 or by email at bcsubmissions@knowsley.gov.uk

Email your completed application to: bcsubmissions@knowsley.gov.uk

How to pay

Online

You can pay for your application online, please ensure you forward the payment confirmation to bcsubmissions@knowsley.gov.uk

Telephone

  • 0151 443 2029
  • or
  • 0151 443 5830

More information

Communities and Local Government approved building regulation documents and publications.

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Feedback

ai_issue.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Issue

ai_improvement.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Improvement

text_issues.Issue: The page explains building regulation approval but doesn’t clearly specify how to request permission for small flat improvements like installing a kitchen or handrail, nor does it detail the process for straightforward modifications.
text_issues.original:
Apply for building regulation approval
Building regulations set standards for the design and construction of buildings for health and safety purposes, energy conservation and access to and about buildings.
text_issues.improvement: To request permission for small changes like installing a new kitchen or handrail, use our simple online form to upload photos or plans and track your application status.
text_issues.why: This improvement simplifies the process by providing specific guidance tailored for tenants making minor changes, directly addressing the lack of clarity for straightforward requests and making it easier to understand how to proceed.

text_issues.Issue: Yes, it would help to have a simple step-by-step guide specifically for small renovation requests, including how to upload photos or plans and what to expect in terms of approval times.
text_issues.original: Please Note: If you are unsure which form you should use or type of application you should submit, please see the following link or contact Knowsley MBC Building Control on 0151 443 2029 / 0151 443 5830 or by email at bcsubmissions@knowsley.gov.uk
text_issues.improvement: Follow these simple steps to request permission for flat improvements: fill out the online form, upload photos or plans, and wait for approval, which typically takes a few weeks depending on the request.
text_issues.why: Providing a clear, concise step-by-step process makes it easier for tenants like David to understand what to do, reducing uncertainty and aligning with their preference for straightforward online services.

text_issues.Issue: Providing a dedicated section or clear links for minor improvements and a summary of the process tailored for tenants wanting quick, straightforward permissions would make this more user-friendly.
text_issues.original:
Apply for Building Regulations Approval
Building Notice Application Form
OR
Full Plans Application Form
Full Plans Application Guidance & Checklist
text_issues.improvement: For small improvements such as installing a handrail or updating your kitchen, visit our dedicated tenant improvement page where you can find a simple form, instructions, and estimated processing times.
text_issues.why: A dedicated, easy-to-find page with clear instructions and relevant forms will help tenants quickly identify the correct process, making the information more accessible and reducing frustration caused by generic or complex pages.

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Knowsley - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
Recommendation to the CEO from the Web Manager

Subject: Enhancing the Tenant Flat Improvement Portal for Increased Efficiency and Customer Satisfaction

Overview:
Our recent user feedback analysis highlights an opportunity to streamline the online process for tenants like David, who wish to make small improvements to their flats, such as installing a kitchen or handrail. While the current page provides comprehensive building regulation information, it lacks clarity and guidance tailored specifically for straightforward, minor renovation requests.

Current Challenges:
- The page does not explicitly guide tenants on how to request permission for minor alterations, leading to confusion.
- There is no dedicated, easy-to-navigate pathway for small improvement requests, which may discourage use or cause delays.
- Users like David are concerned about delays, lack of updates, and potential procedural errors, indicating a need for clearer communication and process transparency.

Suggested Improvements:
1. Create a dedicated, prominent section or landing page specifically for tenants seeking minor improvements. This should include:
   - A simple, step-by-step guide on how to request permission, including completing an easy online form.
   - Clear instructions on what types of photos or plans to upload.
   - Estimated timelines for approval, to manage expectations and reduce uncertainty.

2. Develop a streamlined online form designed specifically for minor flat modifications, enabling users to:
   - Upload relevant images or plans directly within the form.
   - Track application status in real time.
   - Receive automatic updates and notifications, ensuring tenants feel informed throughout the process.

3. Incorporate FAQs or quick reference links addressing common questions, especially around timelines and procedural steps for small projects.

Impact:
Implementing these improvements will significantly enhance the user experience for tenants, making the process more intuitive and less time-consuming. A clearer, simplified process will reduce administrative queries, cut down on processing times, and decrease the likelihood of procedural errors, thereby saving the council money. Additionally, proactive communication through automated updates will increase tenant satisfaction and trust.

In conclusion, prioritizing these user-centric design enhancements aligns with our goal of efficient service delivery and can foster a more positive relationship with our tenants. I recommend allocating resources to redesign this portal section, which promises to deliver substantial operational efficiencies and improved resident engagement.

Respectfully,
[Your Name]
Web Manager & Usability Specialist
